Title: bit_length
Feature: bit_length ( bytea ) → integer
Description: Returns number of bits in the binary string (8 times the octet_length).

Title: btrim
Feature: btrim ( bytes bytea, bytesremoved bytea ) → bytea
Description: Removes the longest string containing only bytes appearing in bytesremoved from the start and end of bytes.

Title: ltrim
Feature: ltrim ( bytes bytea, bytesremoved bytea ) → bytea
Description: Removes the longest string containing only bytes appearing in bytesremoved from the start of bytes.

Title: octet_length
Feature: octet_length ( bytea ) → integer
Description: Returns number of bytes in the binary string.

Title: overlay
Feature: overlay ( bytes bytea PLACING newsubstring bytea FROM start integer [ FOR count integer ] ) → bytea
Description: Replaces the substring of bytes that starts at the start'th byte and extends for count bytes with newsubstring. If count is omitted, it defaults to the length of newsubstring.

Title: position
Feature: position ( substring bytea IN bytes bytea ) → integer
Description: Returns first starting index of the specified substring within bytes, or zero if it's not present.

Title: rtrim
Feature: rtrim ( bytes bytea, bytesremoved bytea ) → bytea
Description: Removes the longest string containing only bytes appearing in bytesremoved from the end of bytes.

Title: substring
Feature: substring ( bytes bytea [ FROM start integer ] [ FOR count integer ] ) → bytea
Description: Extracts the substring of bytes starting at the start'th byte if that is specified, and stopping after count bytes if that is specified. Provide at least one of start and count.

Title: trim
Feature: trim ( [ LEADING | TRAILING | BOTH ] [ FROM ] bytes bytea, bytesremoved bytea ) → bytea
Description: This is a non-standard syntax for trim().

Title: bit_count
Feature: bit_count ( bytes bytea ) → bigint
Description: Returns the number of bits set in the binary string (also known as “popcount”).

Title: get_bit
Feature: get_bit ( bytes bytea, n bigint ) → integer
Description: Extracts n'th bit from binary string.

Title: get_byte
Feature: get_byte ( bytes bytea, n integer ) → integer
Description: Extracts n'th byte from binary string.

Title: length
Feature: length ( bytes bytea, encoding name ) → integer
Description: Returns the number of characters in the binary string, assuming that it is text in the given encoding.

Title: md5
Feature: md5 ( bytea ) → text
Description: Computes the MD5 hash of the binary string, with the result written in hexadecimal.

Title: set_bit
Feature: set_bit ( bytes bytea, n bigint, newvalue integer ) → bytea
Description: Sets n'th bit in binary string to newvalue.

Title: set_byte
Feature: set_byte ( bytes bytea, n integer, newvalue integer ) → bytea
Description: Sets n'th byte in binary string to newvalue.

Title: sha224
Feature: sha224 ( bytea ) → bytea
Description: Computes the SHA-224 hash of the binary string.

Title: sha256
Feature: sha256 ( bytea ) → bytea
Description: Computes the SHA-256 hash of the binary string.

Title: sha384
Feature: sha384 ( bytea ) → bytea
Description: Computes the SHA-384 hash of the binary string.

Title: sha512
Feature: sha512 ( bytea ) → bytea
Description: Computes the SHA-512 hash of the binary string.

Title: substr
Feature: substr ( bytes bytea, start integer [, count integer ] ) → bytea
Description: Extracts the substring of bytes starting at the start'th byte, and extending for count bytes if that is specified. (Same as substring(bytes from start for count).)

Title: convert
Feature: convert ( bytes bytea, src_encoding name, dest_encoding name ) → bytea
Description: Converts a binary string representing text in encoding src_encoding to a binary string in encoding dest_encoding (see Section 24.3.4 for available conversions).

Title: convert_from
Feature: convert_from ( bytes bytea, src_encoding name ) → text
Description: Converts a binary string representing text in encoding src_encoding to text in the database encoding (see Section 24.3.4 for available conversions).

Title: convert_to
Feature: convert_to ( string text, dest_encoding name ) → bytea
Description: Converts a text string (in the database encoding) to a binary string encoded in encoding dest_encoding (see Section 24.3.4 for available conversions).

Title: encode
Feature: encode ( bytes bytea, format text ) → text
Description: Encodes binary data into a textual representation; supported format values are: base64, escape, hex.

Title: decode
Feature: decode ( string text, format text ) → bytea
Description: Decodes binary data from a textual representation; supported format values are the same as for encode.
